body_html:
@hholst80 no problem. It's a bit confusing to me too, you can pass it in either tf.Session(config=) or tf.train.Server(config=), and some options (inter_op_parallelism_threads) seem to be silently ignored in the first method, while others (log_device_placement) are respected. We had a similar problem of too much CPU usage because of this

@mrry any advice as to whether we should ever use tf.Session(config=) option when session connects to distributed master?

body:
@hholst80 no problem. It's a bit confusing to me too, you can pass it in either tf.Session(config=) or tf.train.Server(config=), and some options (inter_op_parallelism_threads) seem to be silently ignored in the first method, while others (log_device_placement) are respected. We had a similar problem of too much CPU usage because of this

@mrry any advice as to whether we should ever use tf.Session(config=) option when session connects to distributed master?
